Docs.summary: Initializes a new

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string authenticationScheme) cil managed

Docs.param: will be used to when creating the for the AuthenticationScheme property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new
Docs.remarks:
Defaults:
AddNonceToRequest: true.
BackchannelTimeout: 1 minute.
Caption: .
ProtocolValidator: new .
RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound: true
ResponseType:
Scope: .
TokenValidationParameters: new with AuthenticationScheme = authenticationScheme.
UseTokenLifetime: false.

Docs.summary: Configuration provided directly by the developer. If provided, then MetadataAddress and the Backchannel properties will not be used. This information should not be updated during request processing.

public: property Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ ConfigurationManager { Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::IConfigurationManager<Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectConfiguration ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Responsible for retrieving, caching, and refreshing the configuration from metadata. If not provided, then one will be created using the MetadataAddress and Backchannel properties.

Docs.summary: Boolean to set whether the middleware should go to user info endpoint to retrieve additional claims or not after creating an identity from id_token received from token endpoint. The default is 'false'.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PostLogoutRedirectUri { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.PostLogoutRedirectUri : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The uri where the user agent will be returned to after application is signed out from the identity provider. The redirect will happen after the SignedOutCallbackPath is invoked.
Docs.remarks: This URI can be out of the application's domain. By default it points to the root.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator ^ ProtocolValidator { Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::IdentityModel::Protocols::OpenIdConnect::OpenIdConnectProtocolValidator ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the that is used to ensure that the 'id_token' received is valid per: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDTokenValidation

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.RefreshOnIssuerKeyNotFound : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if a metadata refresh should be attempted after a SecurityTokenSignatureKeyNotFoundException. This allows for automatic recovery in the event of a signature key rollover. This is enabled by default.

Docs.summary: Requests received on this path will cause the middleware to invoke SignOut using the SignInScheme.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if HTTPS is required for the metadata address or authority. The default is true. This should be disabled only in development environments.

Docs.summary: The Authentication Scheme to use with SignOut on the SignOutPath. SignInScheme will be used if this is not set.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool SkipUnrecognizedRequests { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.SkipUnrecognizedRequests : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates if requests to the CallbackPath may also be for other components. If enabled the middleware will pass requests through that do not contain OpenIdConnect authentication responses. Disabling this and setting the CallbackPath to a dedicated endpoint may provide better error handling. This is disabled by default.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UseTokenLifetime { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UseTokenLifetime : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates that the authentication session lifetime (e.g. cookies) should match that of the authentication token. If the token does not provide lifetime information then normal session lifetimes will be used. This is disabled by default.
